raw_html:
Paracetamol: reminder of updated dosing recommendations for children

Article date: November 2011

We recently informed you that updated dosing recommendations for paediatric paracetamol liquids had been developed to ensure children receive optimum dosing for their age (see Drug Safety Update July 2011).

Products labelled with the new recommendations are now entering the market, and we would like to remind you of the updated dosing regimens which can be accessed via the weblink above.

Furthermore, a detailed report on this update to liquid paracetamol medicines is also available by clicking here.

Further information:

BNF section 4.7.1 Non-opioid analgesics

 Article citation: Drug Safety Update Nov 2011, vol 5 issue 4: S1.
body:
Article date: November 2011

We recently informed you that updated dosing recommendations for paediatric paracetamol liquids had been developed to ensure children receive optimum dosing for their age (see [Drug Safety Update July 2011](http://www.mhra.gov.uk/Safetyinformation/DrugSafetyUpdate/CON123113)).

Products labelled with the new recommendations are now entering the market, and we would like to remind you of the updated dosing regimens which can be accessed via the weblink above.

Furthermore, a detailed report on this update to liquid paracetamol medicines is also available [by clicking here](http://www.mhra.gov.uk/Safetyinformation/Safetywarningsalertsandrecalls/Safetywarningsandmessagesformedicines/CON134919).

Further information:

BNF section 4.7.1 [Non-opioid analgesics](http://bnf.org/bnf/bnf/current/3457.htm)

 Article citation: Drug Safety Update Nov 2011, vol 5 issue 4: S1.
